cab.content: ft t1 b-THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY1S GOVERNMENT)An ignition of Cordite in one of the drying stoves at the Royal Gunpowder Factory, Walt ham Abbey, took placeabout 6s30.p.m. on the evening o^he 19th December, 1917, The fire communicated to another similar drying stove almost immediately opposite. Both stoves were destroyed; no other buildings were damaged.No workers were in the stoves or their vicinity and no one was injured,No reduction in output will result.183E C RET.FAR CABINET.G.T. 3057.MINISTRY OF MUNITIONS, 20/12/1917,
